content:
Diagnosis:	Recurrent non-small cell lung cancer (adenocarcinoma) right upper lobe
	Stage T2aN1M0 at recurrence
	Completed radical radiotherapy 55Gy in 20 fractions to bilateral thoracic disease 15/03/2024

Current situation:
- Progressive dyspnea on minimal exertion
- Intermittent hemoptysis for 4 weeks, evaluated in Emergency Department twice

CT Thorax 22/05/2024 - Summary:
Partial response in primary right upper lobe mass and mediastinal nodes post-radiotherapy.
Stable left hilar adenopathy.
New 6mm nodule right middle lobe concerning for disease progression.
Diffuse radiation-induced lung changes in both upper zones.

Plan:
- Previous extensive bilateral thoracic radiotherapy precludes further radiation treatment due to cumulative lung dose constraints
- Case reviewed at Thoracic MDT - new RML nodule requires interval imaging for characterization
- Surveillance CT in 12 weeks
- Cardiology review pending for assessment of cor pulmonale
- Will utilize cardiology imaging if performed, otherwise proceed with planned CT

cancer_timeline.value: Completed radical radiotherapy 55Gy in 20 fractions to bilateral thoracic disease
New 6mm nodule right middle lobe concerning for disease progression

patient_facts.value: CT shows partial response in primary right upper lobe mass and mediastinal nodes post-radiotherapy with stable left hilar adenopathy

status_updates.value: Recurrent NSCLC post radiotherapy showing mixed response with new suspicious nodule, complicated by radiation-induced lung changes and progressive respiratory symptoms.
Partial response in primary mass and mediastinal nodes but new suspicious RML nodule
Further radiotherapy contraindicated due to cumulative lung dose constraints
new RML nodule requires interval imaging, surveillance CT in 12 weeks
Cardiology review pending for assessment of cor pulmonale
